page.title: 16MERE HALL AND ESTATE
page.content: THE BUCKLOW HUNDRED DIVISION OF CHESHIRE WAS ONCE DESCRIBED AS 'THE SEED PLOT OF GENTILITY' BECAUSE OF ITS MANY LANDED GENTRY OF ANCIENT DESCENT. OF 17 SUCH ESTATES ONLY MERE IS LEFT STILL RUNNING ON TRADITIONAL LINES. THE {BROOKE}FAMILY BOUGHT THE ESTATE FROM THE MERES AS FORTUNES CHANGED FOLLOWING THE CIVIL WAR. SIR PETER BROOKE WAS KNIGHTED AND BUILT THE JACOBEAN HALL. THEIR FORTUNES INCREASED AFTER MARRIAGE TO A LANGFORD HEIRESS; FIRES AND EARLY DEATHS DOGGED THE LANGFORD-BROOKE FAMILY. {THE ESTATE} COVERS 893 ACRES CONSISTING OF{5 FARMS,21 COTTAGES AND {210 ACRES OF MIXED WOODLAND,}USED AS A PRIVATE SHOOT.THE HALL, OAK PANELLED AND ADORNED WITH FAMILY PORTRAITS OVERLOOKS MATURE PARKLAND WITH OLD OAK TREES. A TIMELESS QUALITY PREVAILS.
